anglerfish.description: The anglerfish is a fish that uses a bioluminescent lure at the tip of a stalk protruding from its head to attract prey.
specialQualities: lure (sheds light as per a candle)

archaeopteryx.description: This primeval toothed bird has bright plumage, but it is a relatively poor flyer.

armorfish.description: The armorfish is a primeval aquatic creature that has exceptionally thick armored scales along its head and back.

bear, grizzly.description: The infamous grizzly bear is a lumbering and quite impressive companion, particularly when it rises up on its hind feet to loom large. Grizzly bears strike fear into the hearts of most who encounter them.

bird, owl (giant).description: Unlike the magical beast of the same name, this owl is a mundane but unusually large specimen of its kind, with powerful wings and deadly talons.

bustard.description: The bustard is a sizable bird with long legs. Bustards can fly, but they do so relatively poorly and prefer to walk or run.

capybara.description: This large, brown-furred rodent is equally at home on land or in the water, and is often found near lakes and rivers.

cattle.description: Commonly seen as a docile farm animal, an ill-tempered bull or cow can be an effective animal companion as well.

chimpanzee.description: This small primate is more dangerous than its size suggests.

deer, reindeer.description: A denizen of the frozen tundra, the reindeer is a sure-footed companion in icy terrain, and it can used for transportation as well as defense.
specialQualities: snow adaptation (ignore difficult terrain from ice and snow)

eohippus.description: The eohippus is a small, primeval ancestor of the modern horse. It has three-toed feet rather than hooves.

faerie mount.description: Short legs and overlarge ears make this broad-chested canine seem almost comical.

falcon.description: This swift raptor has amazing eyesight and sharp talons.

frilled lizard, giant.description: This large lizard can display a frightening frill on its neck when it charges.

llama.description: While some value it for its hair, the llama makes a fine animal companion as well, and it has traditionally been used as a beast of burden in mountainous regions.

marsupial devil.description: This toothy marsupial has a perhaps undeserved reputation for ferocity.

marsupial lion.description: Somewhat slimmer than the standard lion, the marsupial lion is no less dangerous in battle.

mole, giant.description: This large-clawed burrowing mammal is slow but can burrow through loose earth and soil with ease to surprise its foes.

moose.description: Powerful and often ill tempered, the moose is an intimidating choice for an animal companion.

ornithomimosaur.description: This bipedal dinosaur has long legs built for speed and a long neck that gives it an ostrichlike profile.

panda.description: Normally slow moving and docile, pandas are capable of surprising bursts of activity when needed.

porcupine, giant.description: This lumbering forest creature is adorned with an array of long, sharp quills that protrude from its coarse pelt.

prionosuchus.description: This primeval crocodile is equally effective in the water and on land. Its jaws are capable of crushing things with great force.

python, riding.description: Note This companion was originally intended for kobolds. Consult your GM before choosing this animal. A kobold cavalier can select this as a mount instead of a dog or pony.

saber-toothed cat.description: Somewhat smaller than the more ferocious saber-toothed tiger, the saber-toothed cat is nonetheless an impressive predatory creature.

salamander, cave.description: Note This companion was originally intended for kobolds. Consult your GM before choosing this animal. A kobold cavalier can select this as a mount instead of a dog or pony.

salamander, giant.description: This oversized amphibian has a mouth full of tiny but rather sharp teeth.

shark, hammerhead.description: This unusual shark is named for its blocky, rectangular head. The creature’s eyes are on each side of its head.

skunk, giant.description: Its unmistakable black-and-white-striped coloration gives a clear warning sign to any who’ve experienced this foul-smelling creature’s ire.

snake, reef.description: Highly venomous and an excellent swimmer, the brightly colored reef snake is at home in tidal waters but can slither about on land if needed.

snake, spitting cobra.description: This brightly colored snake can spit its venom, giving it a dangerous ranged attack.

squid, giant.description: Although this creature isn’t nearly the size of a true giant squid, it remains large enough to do serious damage to foes with its many tentacles.

wolfdog.description: This creature is a dependable hybrid of wolf and dog.

yak.description: Stout and stubborn, the yak is sure footed and dependable in rough terrain.

specialQualities: pack animal (speed is never modified by encumbrance)

zebra.description: The iconic black and white stripes of the zebra make it instantly recognizable.
